div.p: M65/7463, unit 104, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor to inform you, that according to your kind permission I shall proceed to Kilmore this afternoon but return to my office tomorrow morning.
M went to Kilmore, Vic, to deliver a lecture in support of the efforts of the 'ladies of Kilmore' to raise funds for the Ladies' Leichhardt Search Expedition (Kilmore free press and Counties of Bourke and Dalhousie advertiser, 17 August 1865, p. 3, which prints the text of the lecture, B65.08.02).

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
